intro: Luisia yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan luisia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant has oval-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in mountainous regions, where it grows on rocky slopes or in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
